Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the lack of protesters outside the Phoenix Convention Center, as there were actually "tens of thousands" of people protesting, according to the Phoenix Police Chief.
Understate: The claim understates the number of protesters outside the Phoenix Convention Center by suggesting that there weren't too many people protesting, despite evidence to the contrary.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by contradicting the fact that there were significant crowds of protesters outside the Phoenix Convention Center, as shown by TV news coverage and the statements of the Phoenix Police Chief.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the assertion that there weren't too many people protesting outside the Phoenix Convention Center, as there is evidence to the contrary.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the lack of protesters outside the Phoenix Convention Center is due to the hot weather, without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the lack of protesters outside the Phoenix Convention Center, such as the possibility that people were not allowed to gather in certain areas or that they were dispersed by law enforcement.
